com.kuka.roboticsAPI.sensorModel
Class Sensor<T extends ISensorData<T>>

java.lang.Object
  com.kuka.common.TaggableObject
      com.kuka.roboticsAPI.geometricModel.SceneGraphObject
          com.kuka.roboticsAPI.geometricModel.SpatialObject
              com.kuka.roboticsAPI.geometricModel.PhysicalObject
                  com.kuka.roboticsAPI.deviceModel.Device
                      com.kuka.roboticsAPI.sensorModel.Sensor<T>
Type Parameters:
T - type of the sensor data
All Implemented Interfaces:
com.kuka.common.ITaggable
Direct Known Subclasses:
MockLaserSensor, SensorForExternalForce, SensorForExternalTorque, SensorForMeasuredTorque
public abstract class Sensor<T extends ISensorData<T>>
extends Device

Base class for sensors. A sensor is a device providing some arbitrary sensor data.

This element is an undocumented internal feature. It is not intended to be used by applications as it might change or be removed in future versions.

                 java.lang.String name)

name - The name of the device.
Method Detail

getSensorData

public T getSensorData()
Gets a processed snapshot of the current sensor data. All registered data processors have processed the data before it is returned.

Returns:
A processed snapshot of the current sensor data.
This element is an undocumented internal feature. It is not intended to be used by applications as it might change or be removed in future versions.

refreshSensorData

protected T refreshSensorData()
Refreshes the current sensor data.

Returns:
the request result

createRequest

protected GetSensorDataRequest<T> createRequest()
Creates a GetSensorDataRequest for the sensor.

Returns:
The sensor specific request.

processSensorData

protected T processSensorData(T data)
Processes the sensor data through additional data processors.

Parameters:
data - the data to be processed (might be changed)
Returns:
the processed data

deleteProcessors

public void deleteProcessors()
Deletes all registered data processors.

This element is an undocumented internal feature. It is not intended to be used by applications as it might change or be removed in future versions.

addProcessor

public void addProcessor(ISensorDataProcessor<T> processor)
Adds a data processor to this sensor. The order of the processors is important because they are called one after other (processing-chain).

Parameters:
processor - The processor which should be added. null is not allowed.
This element is an undocumented internal feature. It is not intended to be used by applications as it might change or be removed in future versions.

deleteProcessor

public void deleteProcessor(ISensorDataProcessor<T> processor)
Removes a data processor.

Parameters:
processor - The processor which should be removed. null is not allowed.
This element is an undocumented internal feature. It is not intended to be used by applications as it might change or be removed in future versions.
